required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess Oropharyngeal Carriage of N. Meningitidis in South Australian School Leavers
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational Cross-sectional Study to Assess Oropharyngeal Carriage of N. Meningitidis in South Australian School Leavers

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational cross sectional study to evaluate the impact of a 4CMenB vaccination program on oropharyngeal N. meningitidis carriage in vaccinated and unvaccinated school leavers.

detailed_description.textblock:
This carriage study of a cohort of school leavers in South Australia (SA) will provide an opportunity to assess carriage rates in the young adult population (school leavers) following introduction of a 4CMenB vaccination program in senior school students from 2017-2018.This will allow a comparison of carriage prevalence in the two years (2018 and 2019) following implementation of the school program to assess impact on carriage at a population level and compare carriage prevalence in vaccinated versus non-vaccinated groups. Assessment of any association between risk factors and prevalence of nasopharyngeal carriage in school leavers will be made and compared between vaccinated and unvaccinated students.
School leavers are defined as students who were enrolled in year 12 at school in the preceding year of recruitment and have been chosen as they are likely to have the highest carriage rates. A high proportion (approximately two thirds) of students will be immunised by the time of throat swab collection in years 2018 and 2019. Assessing carriage in both vaccinated and unvaccinated cohorts will further inform the effect of 4CMenB vaccine on carriage at a population level. This will help determine any herd immunity impact of 4CMenB vaccine and persistence of any effect.

primary_outcome.measure: Carriage prevalence of disease causing genogroups of N.meningitidis (A, B, C, W, X, Y) in South Australian school leavers
primary_outcome.description: As measured by PCR in school leavers in 2018 and 2019

secondary_outcome.measure: Carriage prevalence of all N. meningitidis genogroups in South Australian school leavers
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by PCR in school leavers in 2018 and 2019

secondary_outcome.measure: Carriage prevalence of each N. meningitidis genogroup (A, B, C, W, X, Y) in South Australian school leavers
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by PCR in school leavers in 2018 and 2019

secondary_outcome.measure: Carriage prevalence of all N. meningitidis genogroups in South Australian school leavers who have received Bexsero ® and in unvaccinated students.
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by PCR in vaccinated and unvaccinated school leavers

secondary_outcome.measure: Carriage prevalence of N. meningitidis genogroups causing disease (A, B, C, W, X, Y) in South Australian school leavers who receivedBexsero ® and in unvaccinated students.
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by PCR in vaccinated and unvaccinated school leavers in 2018 and 2019

secondary_outcome.measure: Carriage prevalence of each N. meningitidis genogroup in South Australian school leavers who received Bexsero ® and in unvaccinated students.
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by PCR in vaccinated and unvaccinated school leavers

secondary_outcome.measure: Characteristics associated with carriage prevalence of all N. meningitidis genogroups in South Australian school leavers in 2018 / 2019.
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by PCR in school leavers and questionnaire

other_outcome.measure: Carriage density of N. meningitidis genogroups as measured by qPCR in school leavers in 2018 and 2019.
other_outcome.description: Density of N. meningitides by qPCR

other_outcome.measure: Whole genome sequencing of invasive isolates (genogroup A, B, C, W, X, Y)
other_outcome.description: Whole genome sequencing of N. meningitidis

arm_group.description: School leavers not vaccinated with 4CMenB vaccine

study_pop.textblock: School leavers recruited through tertiary education sites and mail out through schools.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- South Australian school leavers between 17 to 25 years of age (enrolled in year 12 in the previous year ie year 2018, students are eligible if they were enrollled in year 12 in 2017, year 2019, students are eligible if they were enrolled in year 12 in 2018).
Exclusion Criteria:
- No exclusion criteria
